{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dental amalgam is a common material used in fillings. It is a mixture of metals, consisting of liquid mercury and a powdered alloy composed of silver, tin, and copper. The mercury content in dental amalgam is typically around 50%. However, due to health concerns, modern precapsulated dental amalgam has reduced the mercury content. The mercury content in modern precapsulated dental amalgam is typically around 40-45% by weight.", "answer_choice": "B. 40-45% hg by wt."}
